radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver demonstrates diffuse increase in echogenicity, consistent with fatty infiltration. Focal areas of fat sparing are seen in the gallbladder fossa. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilation. The common bile duct is normal, measuring 5 mm. The main portal vein has normal hepatopetal flow. The gallbladder is distended, with multiple gallstones. No gallbladder wall edema or pericholecystic fluid is seen. ___ sign is positive. Head of the pancreas is normal, but the remainder is obscured by overlying bowel gas.
